alert.note: Alert for Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 3:03PM CDT until July 20 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MDT/330 PM CDT/ FOR NORTHERN WICHITA...SOUTHEASTERN WALLACE... SOUTHWESTERN LOGAN AND NORTHEASTERN GREELEY COUNTIES... At 202 PM MDT/302 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of Leoti, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Wichita, southeastern Wallace, southwestern Logan and northeastern Greeley Counties. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
